article_title: Why Trump supporters are so angry
article_text:
Why Trump supporters are so angry

Photo: Charles Rex Arbogast, AP Supporters of Donald Trump, left, face off with protesters after a...

We can’t heal the schism in this country until we understand that the poor and working-class white people who support Donald Trump have real grievances.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: By Terry Gomes
article_metadata.description: NAFTA, negotiated by corporations and a Democratic president, has exported manufacturing jobs.  Immigrants have taken over the jobs that can’t be exported, especially those in the construction and food industries.  Many drugs cost more than people can pay, and Medicare can’t negotiate to lower the prices.  Instead of providing relief, the act protected the profits of insurance and drug companies and mandated an ever-increasing financial burden on both workers and employers.  Barack Obama publicly defends the rights of Muslims to follow the Quran while privately disparaging rednecks for clinging to their guns and bibles.  Sadly Trump sees that anger and misdirects it, blaming immigrants and minorities who are also victims of those policies.  After harnessing the anger, Trump advocates trickle-down economics to improve the precarious economic state of poorer whites.  The last three Democratic presidents followed Republican administrations whose policies favored the rich at the expense of everyone else.  Bill Clinton furthered the Republican policies by enacting welfare reform, deregulation and free trade.  To do that, the Democrats must acknowledge the legitimacy of the people’s anger and admit that the Democrats are partially responsible for the economic situation that imperils poor and working-class whites.
